section.title: General
section.para: A brief overview of some of the characteristics of the Arabic language that make it very distinct from e.g. English.

section.title: High Arabic - العربية الفصحى
section.para: The role of High Arabic in Mamluk and Modern Egypt - authority and prestige. Its connection with cultural institutions. Al-Azhar and the teaching of the traditional Arabic Sciences. Use in "official" writing. Prestige of the language of the Quran.

Political uses of High Arabic - the way institutions try to acquire legitimacy by "speaking" in High Arabic. How this shows up in genres, e.g. announcements, official speeches, etc. One way to gain an advantage over an opponent is to speak better, more classical Arabic.

section.title: Middle Arabic
section.para: Traditionally treated as a degenerate form of Arabic, etc.
al-Ghitāhi: Egyptian middle Arabic as بلاغة مصرية, Egyptian idiom, a first-class literary language with its own distinctive expressive capabilities.
